metadata.title: CVE-2021-3472 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server in versions before 1.20.11. An integerunderflow can occur in xserver which can lead to a local privilegeescalation. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xdmx-tools - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xnest - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xorg-server-source - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xserver-common - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xvfb - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
xwayland - 2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.9-2ubuntu1.2~20.04.2').
